com.shearosario.tothepathandback

Class ClosestStationsIntent

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shearosario.tothepathandback.ClosestStationsIntent

  • public class ClosestStationsIntent
extends java.lang.Object
    Serves to prepare an intent, that'll be sent to the next activity (ClosestStationsAcitivity) when we start it. We call to create the URLs for each station, call on them and save what is returned. If it is viable, then extract a sort measure (distance/duration) specified by the user, and we will use it to select and sort three stations for use. After we follow a similar process for all the appropariate entrances at each of the three stations. However, we only selected one entrance for each station. The sort measure used, the stations and their entrance, are then put into an intent and the activity is called.
    Author:
    shea

    • Method Detail

      • getHandicapAccessStations

        private java.util.ArrayList<Station> getHandicapAccessStations()
        If the user has selected in the main activity that they need to enter a station through a handicap entrance, then here we select the stations that have that specific type of entrance.
        Returns:
        an arraylist of stations that have a specific handicap entrance selected by the user

      • getOriginState

        private java.lang.String getOriginState(com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng origin)
        Calls on downloadReverseGeoCode class to obtain the state where the origin is at. If it is in New York or New Jersey, then we return the abbreviation of it. Else, we return the full name of the state. The reason for this is to eliminate URL calls for all stations. This way, we only call on stations that are in the same state as the origin location (provided they're in NY or NJ).
        Parameters:
        origin - the origin of the user
        Returns:
        the state where the origin is located at

      • createURLs

        private static java.lang.String[] createURLs(java.util.ArrayList<Station> allStations,
                            com.google.android.gms.maps.model.LatLng origin)
        Create an array list of Strings. Each element is a URL for each station in the array list. We'll use the URL to call and obtain a route matrix.
        Parameters:
        allStations - an array list of stations
        origin - the origin location
        Returns:
        an array of String, a URL for each station object

      • downloadJSON

        private java.lang.String[] downloadJSON(java.lang.String[] urls)
        Using DownloadAllData in Directions, we call each url and then save whatever returns.
        Parameters:
        urls - an array of string urls
        Returns:
        an array of strings, each the result of calling and saving what the url returns

      • getAllSortMeasures

        private double[] getAllSortMeasures(java.lang.String[] data)
        Using getDistanceOrDuration in DirectionsJSONParser, we parse each string and extract the value of either distance or duration from the origin to each location searched.
        Parameters:
        data - an array of string with each element being whatever is returned from their respective URL calls
        Returns:
        a double array for the sort measure that is obtained from each data string

      • sortWithMeasures

        private <T> java.util.ArrayList<T> sortWithMeasures(java.util.ArrayList<T> allObjects,
                                          double[] allSortMeasures)
        This is possible because we have kept the order of whatever is being searched for with API calls to Open Mapquest and what has returned. We can now compare each location with their respective distance or duration from the origin. The work is done by storing the index of the smallest element value possible in allSortMeasures into an array of size 1 to 3. We traverse the sort measures as many times as there are indices that we must save. For example, if we are working with an Entrance object, then we only need to save one index, the smallest element in allSortMeasures.

        After we obtain each index, we then get the object in the array list that corresponds with the index we stored and add them to an array list that'll be returned. The result is a limited array list of objects that are in order based on their distance or duration from the origin.

        Parameters:
        allObjects - an array list of objects
        allSortMeasures - a double array of sort measures
        Returns:
        an array list of ordered object from allObjects based on the ascending order of allSortMeasures
